definitions.definition: True facts, genuine depiction or statements of reality.
examples: The truth is that our leaders knew a lot more than they were letting on.

definitions.definition: Conformity to fact or reality ; correctness , accuracy .
examples: There was some truth in his statement that he had no other choice.

definitions.definition: The state or quality of being true to someone or something.
examples: Truth to one's own feelings is all-important in life.

definitions.definition: A pledge of loyalty or faith.
Conformity to rule; exactness; close correspondence with an example, mood, model, etc.
That which is real , in a deeper sense; spiritual or ‘genuine’ reality.
examples: Alcoholism and redemption led me finally to truth .

definitions.definition: Something acknowledged to be true; a true statement or axiom.
examples: Hunger and jealousy are just eternal truths of human existence.

definitions.definition: Topness ; the property of a truth quark .
In the game truth or dare , the choice to truthfully answer a question put forth.
examples: When asked truth or dare, he picked truth .

main_definition: True facts, genuine depiction or statements of reality.
secondary_definitions: Conformity to fact or reality ; correctness , accuracy .
The state or quality of being true to someone or something.
( obsolete ) A pledge of loyalty or faith.
Conformity to rule; exactness; close correspondence with an example, mood, model, etc.
That which is real , in a deeper sense; spiritual or ‘genuine’ reality.
( countable ) Something acknowledged to be true; a true statement or axiom.
( physics , dated ) Topness ; the property of a truth quark .
( games ) In the game truth or dare , the choice to truthfully answer a question put forth.
